item.title: Dedra add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Writing a novel is a terrible experience, during which the hair often falls out and the teeth decay. I'm always irritated by people who imply that writing fiction is an escape from reality. It is a plunge into reality and it's very shocking to the system." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Dedra add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Dedra add a quote by Colette
item.description:
"Put down everything that comes into your head and then you're a writer. But an author is one who can judge his own stuff's worth, without pity, and destroy most of it."
(<i>Casual Chance</i>, 1964)" -- Colette

item.title: Dedra add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Men are afraid that women will laugh at them. Women are afraid that men will kill them." -- Margaret Atwood
